DOC.brief_summary: It is unknown whether surgical treatment of chronic sinusitis improves asthma control in patients with poorly controlled asthma. This is a randomized trial of surgical plus medical sinus therapy versus medical therapy alone.
DOC.brief_title: Effects of Endoscopic Sinus Surgery for Chronic Sinusitis on Asthma Control
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criteria: General 1. 18 years of age or older 2. Women need one of the following: negative pregnancy test or suitable birth control or postmenopausal status 3. Informed consent and ability to comply with study procedures 4. Patients must meet inclusion criteria for both asthma and sinus disease. Inclusion criteria: Asthma In order to qualify for the 6 week runin, patients must have poorly controlled asthma as defined by the following criteria: 1. Diagnosis of asthma confirmed either by demonstrating a positive methacholine challenge test (defined as a decrease in FEV1 by at least 20%, following administration of 8mg or less of inhaled methacholine) or a positive bronchodilator response (defined as a change from base line of >12% and at least 200ml in either FEV1 or FVC, following administration of a shortacting, inhaled bronchodilator). 2.
